Module io.github.darvil.lanat
Package io.github.darvil.lanat.helpgen.descriptions

Class RouteParser

java.lang.Object
io.github.darvil.lanat.helpgen.descriptions.RouteParser
public class RouteParser extends Object
Parser for simple route syntax used in description tags (e.g. args.myArg1.type).

The route syntax is very simple. It is a dot-separated list of names indicating the path to the object to be returned. By default, the route initial target is the command the user belongs to. If the route starts with !, the user itself becomes the initial target. If the route is empty or null, the command the user belongs to is returned.

These are the objects that can be accessed using the route syntax:

  • args: the arguments of the command.
    • type: the type of the argument.

      Note that this only works if the current target is an Argument.

  • groups: the groups of the command.
  • cmds: the subcommands of the command.

    Note that after selecting a command, all the selectors above can be used again to select inner objects of the command.

Examples

  1. Select the type of the argument myArg1 of the current command: args.myArg1.type
  2. Select the Sub-Command myCmd of the current command: cmds.myCmd
  3. Select the type of the argument myArg1 of the Sub-Command myCmd of the current command: cmds.myCmd.args.myArg1.type
  4. Select the ArgumentType of the Argument that is requesting to parse this description: !.type

  • Method Details

    • parse

      @NotNull public static @NotNull NamedWithDescription parse(@NotNull @NotNull NamedWithDescription user, @Nullable @Nullable String route)
      Parses a route and returns the object it points to. If the route is empty or null, the command the user belongs to is returned.

      The reason why the user is needed is that its likely that it will be necessary to gather the Command it belongs to, and also if the route starts with !, the user itself becomes the initial target.

      Parameters:
      user - the user that is requesting to parse the route
      route - the route to parse
      Returns:
      the object the route points to
      Throws:
      InvalidRouteException - if the route is invalid or the object it points to does not exist
      See Also:
      • RouteParser

    • getCommandOf

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Command getCommandOf(@NotNull @NotNull NamedWithDescription obj)
      Returns the command the object belongs to. If the object is a Command, it is returned. If it is a CommandUser, the command it belongs to is returned. Otherwise, an InvalidRouteException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to get the command of
      Returns:
      the command the object belongs to
      Throws:
      InvalidRouteException - if the object is not a Command or a CommandUser
